resources.string: IRB Quiz Final
When Do You Need IRB Review?
Click Here to Find Out!
Please Enter Your Name Below.
IRB Quiz
1. What does IRB stands for in the context of research?
Information Research Board
Institutional Review Board
Internal Review Board
2. Which one of the following is not one of the two key question you need to ask to determine if your project needs an IRB approval?
Is my project research defined by the common rule?
Will the results of my project be published?
Does my project involve human subjects?
3. Which one of the following is least likely to be research?
An experiment designed to acquire new knowledge
A systematic investigation designed to contribute to generalizable knowledge
A routine testing and analysis of materials
4. Human subjects are a living individual about whom an investigator conducting research obtains data through:
intervention/interaction or identifiable private information
deidentified information
through a trusted data provider
5. Which one of the following would probably require an IRB review? Check all that apply.
A study where participants are recruited to take the political survey.
A case study that involves the assessment of the student outreach program.
An MTurk experiment that gathers the opinions, experiences, or characteristics of the workers.
Next
